content:
I am researching creative solutions for increasing access to healthcare at the intersection of computer science and biology.
I am advised by Dr. Shwetak Patel in the Ubiquitous Computing Lab in the Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering. You might also be able to find me in the Molecular Information Systems Lab (MISL) or the Synthetic Biology Lab.
I previously worked in hardware development at Microsoft, and I am passionate about youth education. Please reach out if you share these interests or want to learn more!
summary:
I am researching creative solutions for increasing access to healthcare at the intersection of computer science and biology.
I am advised by Dr. Shwetak Patel in the Ubiquitous Computing Lab in the Paul G.
title: Jason Hoffman

content:
In collaboration with the Molecular Information Systems Lab (MISL), the Synthetic Biology Lab, and Microsoft, I am investigating new ways to detect viral presence in urban infrastructure.
This project is supported by the Microsoft Pandemic Preparedness Grant and the UW Population Health Economic Recovery Research Grants. Thanks for the support!
More details to come - stay tuned!
summary: Investigating new ways to detect viral presence in urban infrastructure.
title: Environmental RNA Detection

content:
I am investigating the use of a smartphone camera for oximetry in clinical settings for a couple different health applications.
More details to come - stay tuned!
summary: Investigating the use of a smartphone camera for oximetry in clinical settings for a couple different health applications.
title: Smartphone Camera Oximetry
